alt: A New York City skyscraper shot from below. A plane can be seen passing in the distance largely thanks to its long contrail.
caption: Art Deco, or Deco, is an influential visual arts design style that first appeared in France just before World War I and began flourishing internationally in the 1920s, 1930s and 1940s before its popularity waned after World War II.

alt: The downtown New York City skyline, with the Freedom Tower in center-frame.
caption: City skylines serve as a kind of fingerprint as no two skylines are alike.

alt: A close-up shot of blueberries in many small baskets
An arrangement of white, pink, and red flowers sit neatly inside a flowering can, with a note hanging off that reads, 'Be My Pumpkin Valentine! Love from Chubby Hubby'
A blue and orange color-enhanced image of a bubbling nebula
caption: This Hubble Space Telescope image was released to celebrate Hubble's 26th year in orbit.

alt: The Manhattan bridge is centered in the background, framed on either side by buildings along Washington St. in Brooklyn.
caption: The Manhattan Bridge is a suspension bridge that crosses the East River in New York City, connecting Lower Manhattan at Canal Street with Downtown Brooklyn at the Flatbush Avenue Extension.

alt: A kingfisher perched on a branch
caption: The common kingfisher (Alcedo atthis) also known as the Eurasian kingfisher, and river kingfisher, is a small kingfisher with seven subspecies recognized within its wide distribution across Eurasia and North Africa.

alt: Clint Eastwood talks to a Hmong woman and teens. One girls holds two potted plants.
caption: Gran Torino Both Clint Eastwood’s white character and his Hmong neighbors draw conclusions about each other based on race.

alt: Katy Perry in a flowery silk robe with many paper umbrellas arrayed behind her.
caption: Cultural Appropriation For her performance of “Unconditionally” at the American Music Awards, Katy Perry donned a geisha-inspired costume that sparked controversy over her appropriation of Japanese culture.
Rachel Dolezal The former leader of the Spokane, Washington, branch of the NAACP identifies as black despite being born to two white parents.
